question: Where is the "Christ, the Redeemer Statue" located?
explanation: Christ, the Redeemer Statue is a Jesus Christ statue located in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. It is created by French sculptor Paul Landowski. It is located in Corcovado Mountain in the Tijuca Forest National Park. It is one of the "New Seven Wonders of the World". The material used to make the statue is soapstone. It overlooks Rio city and Sugarloaf Mountain. The construction happened between 1922 and 1931.
